remarks: Two words have a common subword (starting at the same position with the same length) iff they have the same symbols at each position. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 7-Aug-2018.)
statement:
swrdspsleq $p |- ( ( ( W e. Word V /\ U e. Word V ) /\ ( M e. NN0 /\ N e. NN0 ) /\ ( N <_ ( # ` W ) /\ N <_ ( # ` U ) ) ) -> ( ( W substr <. M , N >. ) = ( U substr <. M , N >. ) <-> A. i e. ( M ..^ N ) ( W ` i ) = ( U ` i ) ) ) $.
$d M i $.
$d N i $.
$d U i $.
$d V i $.
$d W i $.
